intro: Potentilla tomasii, commonly known as Tomasek's cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, spreading stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are alternate, palmately divided into five oval lobes, and are covered with a dense layer of fine pubescence. Potentilla tomasii thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
